original_title: Sri Lanka tea production down 3.08-pct in March 2023
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s tea production fell 3.08 percent to 21.3 million kilograms in March 2023 from a year ago, industry data showed, with all elevations seeing lower output.

Orthodox high grown teas were down 8.8 percent to 4.1 million kilos, medium growns were down 3.6 percent to 2.87 million kilos and low growns were down 2.9 percent to 12.24 million kilos, data from Ceylon Tea Brokers showed.
CTC tea production grew to 1.87 million kilos in March 2023 from 1.79 million last year.
Green tea production picked up to 248,211 kilos from 117,253 million last year.
In the first quarter production was down 7.2 percent to 58.52 million kilos.

Sri Lanka’s tea production has been in decline for several years due to the combined effect of banning the weedicide glyphosate and later chemical fertilizer, which weakened plantations with a lagged effects, according to industry officials.
Production is expected to recover in 2023, with the fertilizer being applied. (Colombo/Apr20/2023)
